description:
Secure your Future With a Piece of Hills History!

Perched on the Veranda over looking the tree tops across the valley, you are at peace with nature! You can hear the birds, the trees in the breeze and playful noises as the kids (or grandkids) running after the dogs and chickens or chasing the sheep. You pinch yourself to make sure you're not dreaming… “How did I manage to secure such a special property for our family?” you mutter to yourself.

“We looked for ages for the perfect hills home… but it was totally worth the wait” you tell your friends and family. “We hadn't even heard of Mahogany Creek!” A quite little suburb of about 400 properties with only 10 sales in the last 12 months… it's a rare opportunity to buy in the suburb and even more rare to secure a 1930's stone house! “it's a one-of-a-kind property that can never be recreated… we just had to make it our forever home!” Your excitement is evident as you share history of how Allan Mack started to build two little stone cottages at the age of 16 which later on was joined together to make one large stone home oozing with character but having the comforts of the modern kitchen and bathroom's amongst other fixtures and fittings. “All the stone was quarried from this property and the previous owners named it 'Mackallen House' in honour of the original owner and his-story”

Whatever your walk of life, hospitality is a universal language which this home speaks fluently. “We love how our kitchen's large Island bench with engineered stone flows through our living area and then spills out through the glass French doors with valley and tree-top views for miles!” A butlers pantry, loads of cupboard space along with the 900mm wide SMEG oven and 6 burner gas stove are just a few elements of your highly functional kitchen.

This might resonate with you, or your story may be totally different… the beauty of this lovely property is that there is no limit to it's versatility. Here are just a few of our favourites:
1. Character and History – I get to see a lot of homes. This home has so much life and soul! The nearly century old stone work was hand trimmed with incredible craftsmanship.
2. Views – I just love the natural valley and tree top outlook… That's the outlook that I moved to the hills for!
3. Land – 1.17ha (almost 3 acres) is a great size! Not so big that you wonder where to start, but big enough to have livestock, orchards and privacy.
4. Master Suite – We just love how “cool” it is! The free standing bathtub, open “resort” style layout, raked ceiling, timber features and stunning view makes for a quirky but classy retreat.

Many will fall in love with this incredible property and the lifestyle that accompanies it… but only one lucky buyer or family will be blessed to call it home.

SCHOOL CATCHMENT
Parkerville Primary School (4.9 km)
Glen Forrest Primary School (2.9 km)
Eastern Hills Senior High School (12.2 km)

PRIVATE SCHOOLS
Helena College Darlington K-5 (3.7km)
Helena College Glen Forrest (5.1km)
Mundaring Christian School Senior Campus (7.6km)
Mundaring Christian School Primary Campus (6.5km)
Sacred Heart Primary School (4.6km)
Silver Tree Steiner School (6.4km)

RATES
Council: $2600
Water: $139

FEATURES
General
* Build Year 1933 with extensions completed after
* Total Built Area 236 sqm
* High Ceilings
* Raked Ceiling (living area)
* Stained Glass Windows
* Wood Burning Stove (Morso)
* Vinyl Planks
* 3.5” Jarrah Flooring
* Split System Air-conditioning (Panasonic)
* Original Character Ceilings (domes/art)
* Freshly Painted (2022)

Kitchen:
* Engineered Stone Bench-tops
* 6 Burner Gas Stove-top (SMEG)
* 900mm Oven (SMEG)
* 900mm Range Hood
* Butlers Pantry
* Rainwater Spout

Outside
* Artificial Lawn
* 3 x Ponds
* Reticulated Areas (rose garden/orchard/grass)
* 14,000 ltr Rainwater Tank
* 20 Solar Panels
* 5Kw Solar Inverter
* Double carport
* 6.1 x 6.1 Workshop
* Bottled Gas
* Established Vegetable Garden
* Electric Front Gate


Fruit Trees
* Lime, Lemon, Mandarin, Seedless Japanese Mandarin, Naval Oranges, Grapefruit
* Guava, Mango, Apricot, Peach, Cherry, Cherry Plum, Pluot (Plum x apricot)
* Apple, Mulberry, Passionfruit, Grapes, Macadamia

LIFESTYLE
1.8 km – Public Transport
2.9 km – Local Cafe
13 km – Midland Train Station
36.7 km - Perth City
19.6 km – Midland Gate Shopping Centre
5.9 km - John Forrest National Park
12.9 km - St John of God Hospital
20.7 km - Perth Airport
